str2: Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To relax, enfeeble, weaken. From para and luo; to loosen beside, i.e. Relax.
Lame, deprived of a foot, limping. Apparently a primary word; 'halt', i.e. Limping.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From the same as therapon; to wait upon menially, i.e. to adore, or to relieve.
